skill.name: typescript-review
skill.description: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network activity is present in this skill. The content only defines review guidance, with no access to files or environment data.

content.user_title: Review TypeScript changes for Metabase style
content.value_statement: Code reviews can miss style and type safety issues. This skill checks TypeScript and JavaScript diffs against Metabase standards.
actual_capabilities: Review TypeScript and JavaScript diffs for Metabase conventions
Flag code quality and style issues in changes
Check JSDoc clarity and correctness when present
Assess TypeScript type safety in edited code
Review React changes for best practices
limitations: Only reviews the code or diff you provide
Does not run tests or validate runtime behavior
Does not know project context beyond shared files
Cannot enforce standards not described in the prompt

use_cases.title: PR review helper
use_cases.description: Scan a TypeScript diff for Metabase style and type safety issues before requesting review.

use_cases.title: Review checklist
use_cases.description: Use a consistent checklist for JavaScript and React changes across the team.

use_cases.title: Quality gate
use_cases.description: Spot common code quality and JSDoc issues in new changes before QA testing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic diff review
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick check for a small PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this TypeScript diff for Metabase standards and code quality issues. Focus on style, type safety, and JSDoc.

prompt_templates.title: React focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this React TypeScript diff. Check hooks usage, dependency arrays, and component best practices.

prompt_templates.title: JSDoc audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this JavaScript diff and evaluate JSDoc accuracy, completeness, and consistency with code behavior.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced standards check
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a detailed review of this TypeScript diff for Metabase standards, type safety issues, and code quality risks. List findings by severity.

output_examples.input: Review this TypeScript diff for Metabase standards.
output: Found missing dependency in useEffect array.
Suggested explicit return type for exported function.
JSDoc does not match new parameter behavior.

best_practices: Provide the full diff or changed files for context
Note any project standards or lint rules you want enforced
Request findings grouped by severity for faster triage
anti_patterns: Asking for review without sharing code changes
Expecting runtime validation or test execution
Using it to rewrite code without a review goal

faq.question: Is this compatible with JavaScript and TypeScript?
faq.answer: Yes. It reviews JavaScript and TypeScript code changes and related React code.

faq.question: What are the limits of the review?
faq.answer: It only analyzes provided diffs and does not run tests or access repositories.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into a PR workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Paste diffs from your PR and request a structured review.

faq.question: Does it read my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the text you provide in the prompt.

faq.question: What if it misses project-specific rules?
faq.answer: Include your standards in the prompt or link relevant guidelines.

faq.question: How does it compare to linting?
faq.answer: Linting enforces rules automatically, while this skill provides human-style review insights.
